text:
Hi there, I have changed an element on a template and all the text of  the landings depending of this template have turned to its original appearance. So I lost all the text I have edited already and back to "lorem ipsum..." which is the text on the template.
Is it a bug? or is it normal that when you change something on the template the landing or pages based on that template return to its original appearance and lost all the edition you made?  Becouse if that so, we won´t be able to change the template once we have public pages already, it is make not sense. It hadn´t happened to me before.
Yes <@U39U75WDS> imagin if you have a portal with 100 different landings depending on a template!!!
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.

Typically, contents already on a page will take priority over the default contents from the template editor. That is, if you make a page, once its saved its contents are separate and no longer affected by the placeholder content used in the template editor.
If you deleted the original module and replaced with a new one, that would be considered a new module - the page doesn't know it's supposed to be the same one. Is it possible that that's what happened?
can anyone recommend a good image compression tool online? I usually use tinypng but it seems that even after compressing, google's page speed is still flagging it to be compressed more
not web-based, but if I remember correctly this one specifically uses google's specs for optimization: <https://imageoptim.com/mac>
